sndlib.core.util
Class SolutionUtils

java.lang.Object
  sndlib.core.util.SolutionUtils

public class SolutionUtils
extends java.lang.Object

This class provides some commonly used utility methods on a Solution (resp. a SolvedProblem).

Author:
Roman Klaehne

Method Detail

getNodeInDegree

public static int getNodeInDegree(Node node,
                                  SolvedProblem solvedProblem)
Determines the in-degree of the given node with respect to the given solution topology.

If the given problem's LinkModel is DIRECTED then the in-degree of a node is the number of its incident links of which that node is the target.

If the LinkModel is not DIRECTED then there is no definite target node. Thus the in-degree of a node is simply the number of its incident links.

Parameters:
node - the node to calculate the in-degree for
solvedProblem - the solved problem providing the solution topology
Returns:
the in-degree of the given node with respect to the given solution topology.

getNodeOutDegree

public static int getNodeOutDegree(Node node,
                                   SolvedProblem solvedProblem)
Determines the out-degree of the given node with respect to the given solution topology.

If the given problem's LinkModel is DIRECTED then the out-degree of a node is the number of its incident links of which that node is the source.

If the LinkModel is not DIRECTED then there is no definite target node. Thus the out-degree of a node is simply the number of its incident links.

Parameters:
node - the node to calculate the out-degree for
solvedProblem - the solved problem providing the solution topology
Returns:
the out-degree of the given node with respect to the given solution topology.

getNodeDegree

public static int getNodeDegree(Node node,
                                SolvedProblem solvedProblem)
Determines the degree of the given node with respect to the given solution topology.

The degree of a given node is simply the number of its incident links.

Parameters:
node - the node to calculate the degree for
solvedProblem - the solved problem providing the solution topology
Returns:
the degree of the given node with respect to the given solution topology

getTotalInstalledCapacity

Returns the total amount of capacity installed on the link corresponding to the given link configuration.

Parameters:
linkConf - the link configuration providing the capacities installed on the link
Returns:
the total amount of capacity installed on the link corresponding to the given link configuration

getTotalInstalledCapacityCost

public static double getTotalInstalledCapacityCost(Link link,
                                                   LinkConfiguration linkConf)
Returns the total cost of the capacities installed on the given link with respect to the given link configuration. The costs comprises the pre-installed capacity as well as the additionally installed capacities.

Parameters:
link - the link
linkConf - the link configuration providing the capacities installed on the link
Returns:
the total cost of the capacity installed on the given link

getAdditionalModuleCapacityCost

public static double getAdditionalModuleCapacityCost(Link link,
                                                     LinkConfiguration linkConf)
Returns the cost of the capacities additionally installed on the given link with respect to the given link configuration. The pre-installed capacity cost is not considered.

Parameters:
link - the link
linkConf - the link configuration providing the capacities installed on the link
Returns:
the cost of the capacities additionally installed on the given link

toPathSet

public static PathSet toPathSet(DemandRouting routing,
                                LinkModel linkModel)
Constructs a set containing all pairwise different paths of the specified demand routing.

The paths are compared with respect to the given link model. If the link model is UNDIRECTED the direction into which the path is traversed is not taken into account.

If the given routing is null an empty path set is returned.

Parameters:
routing - the demand routing
linkModel - the link model
Returns:
a set containing all pairwise different paths of the specified demand routing

findBackupPathsOfDemand

public static PathSet findBackupPathsOfDemand(Demand demand,
                                              SolvedProblem solvedProblem)
Returns a set containing all pairwise different paths which are additional with respect to the normal operating state (NOS) and used to route the specified demand when the network is in any failure state.

Parameters:
demand - the demand
solvedProblem - the solved problem
Returns:
a set containing all pairwise different backup paths of the specified demand

calculateMaximumLinkFlow

public static MaximumLinkFlow calculateMaximumLinkFlow(Link link,
                                                       SolvedProblem solvedProblem)
Returns the maximum flows on the specified link, together with the states in which the flow values are assumed. The calcuation is performed with respect to the survivability model.

If a dedicated protection mechanism is used the maximum flow on the given link e, for example, is calculated as follows:

  sum_{d \in Demands} max_{s \in States} f(e, d, s) where f(e, d, s) denotes the flow on link e incurred by demand d in state s.

For a shared protection mechanism the calculation looks as follows:

  max_{s \in States} sum_{d \in Demands} f(e, d, s)

Parameters:
link - the link
solvedProblem - the solved problem
Returns:
the maximum flow on the specified link
